Description: 76 x 51 cm. Color. The title is a quote attributed to U.S. Secretary of the Treasury, William Gibbs McAdoo, and his signature is on the poster.  Depicted are a soldier and a sailor bearing a flag and a handbill reading "We Depend On You." Promotes purchase of United States Government Bond of the Second Liberty Loan of 1917.
Digitization: Original items were scanned as 600 dpi tiffs on a Zeutschel OS 14000 A0-LS scanner. They were converted to jpegs (sized at 3000 pixels on the long dimension) using Adobe Photoshop CS2 and subsequently uploaded into CONTENTdm.
Rights Notes: No known copyright. Item is in public domain as it was published prior to 1923.
Source: From: Shall We Be More Tender with Our Dollars Than with the Lives of Our Sons?
Subject: World War, 1914-1918; War Posters, American
Title: Shall We Be More Tender with Our Dollars Than with the Lives of Our Sons?
